data.description:
This story-driven adventure follows a mystery of death and despair from reality into the surreal realms of objective memories and subjective experiences. Search the mind, solve puzzles, and unravel the dark truth in this psychological thriller.

The Signifier is a first-person tech-noir mystery adventure that blends investigation, experimental psychology, and artificial intelligence. 

Explore the real and surreal worlds, become immersed in fringe psychology, solve puzzles, and find the truth as Frederick Russell, an expert in AI and psychology, and the main researcher behind an experimental deep brain scanner called the Dreamwalker. Its controversial technology allows the exploration of the recorded senses and unconscious realms of the mind. He finds himself thrust into a spiral of intrigue when asked to use his creation after the vice president of the world’s biggest tech company turns up dead in her apartment.

changelog.change_log:
* The dialog alternatives are now more differentiated between sitting and standing settings.
* Teleporter collision detection was corrected to better detect the landing spots and valid areas on which you can teleport.
* The size of the tutorial texts was decreased to fit better.
* The goAT colliders in Marie’s office were adjusted to feel smoother.
* The collider of the boiler was adjusted to make interactions more comfortable.
* The area where the exit icon appears (when close to an exit) was adjusted for every exit in the game.
* The size of a few dialog triggers was adjusted for smoother interactions.
* The button to exit the dog avatar was adjusted to make the interaction easier.
* The interaction with the Control Panel was improved by adding additional snap points.

Fixed the following bugs:

* When walking backwards, it was possible to climb on top of furniture.
* The masks puzzle was unsolvable due to some masks remaining activated even after deactivation.
* The player could fall at specific moments (e.g, when teleporting in the goAT elevator, entering the Club scene, exiting the framed picture, transitioning between scenarios during hacking, and going up the ladder in one of the final scenes).
* Raw data was sometimes hard to grab due to getting stuck inside a collider.
* The recall raw data function sometimes did not work.
* The hand sometimes got stuck in the grabbing position when using the timewarp mechanism.
* Entering the Control Panel using the machine at the warehouse while holding the teleport raycast caused the player to appear in the warehouse with the Control Panel's virtual hands, resulting in being stuck.
* The voyeurist’s shirt did not update according to the dialogs.
* The elevator in the goAT scene started open.
* It was possible to come out of the goAT elevator while it was closing.
* The dog avatar could be lost when entering a black room.
* There was an additional scene transition when interacting with an entity.
* Richard’s dog dialogs were not appearing.
* One of Laura’s animations did not work in VR.
* The sounds of orgies could be heard from the upper floors.
* The player could enter rooms and floors that should have been blocked.
* In one of the final scenes, the floor seemed too high.
* A tutorial hand indicating an exit was incorrectly displayed before needed.
* In the Dream Sequence, you could fall from the cornice down to the street, and being blocked to grab the ladder again.
At the Club, the dialog about the framed picture could be seen from inside the framed picture.
* Some interactions in the conversation with Marie at goAT were not working correctly.
* At the Club, the colliders of the ladder to the underground were not working correctly.
* The voyeurist did not look directly into the player's eyes.
* The refrigerator in Russell’s apartment was not visible.
* The sound of Johanna’s keyboard could be heard from the bathroom, which was confusing.
* The position of the dialog for the bookshelf was not centered correctly.
* A shader causing an unintended dithering effect on some shadows and other materials was deactivated.
* The game credits were not correctly positioned at the beginning of the credits screen.
* Other minor cosmetic bugs.

* Hotfix - Fixed an issue where you could end up over furniture when teleporting backwards

* Fixed the bug that caused the Player not to be able to switch to the subjective state, and also to go back to the starting point when switching to the objective state in the Club. 
* Fixed a bug causing various issues on New and Saved Games due to variables not being reset, such as the Control Panel not appearing on the wrist - Note: For games saved before this hotfix, updating and creating a New Game is recommended to avoid potential issues. 
* Fixed a bug that caused the player not to be positioned correctly when teleporting, solving multiple navigation-related issues. 
* Fixed a bug causing an invalid teleport position to bring the player to a position valid on a previous scene. 
* Adjusted colliders and dialog triggers for smoother operation of dialogs and teleportation. 
* Added new snapping points throughout the game to enhance gameplay. 
* Enhanced the Club’s Masks’ Puzzle with a new snapping mechanic, fixed colliders, and adjusted position for the eye icon for entering the puzzle. 
* Enhanced the Control Panel slot system, improving usability and correcting issues causing buttons to move unexpectedly. 
* Improved the Memories Menu: Improved the Exit to Lab and Recall Raw Data buttons. Added highlight when releasing Raw Data to save it on a slot for easier interaction. 
* Corrected the highlight for grabbable objects, ensuring they are highlighted at the correct distance for grabbing. 
* Fixed a bug causing player height to change when cycling through VR settings. 
* Improved functionality of on-screen buttons in the lab for smoother operation. 
* Enhanced readability of the dialog alternatives panel (UI). ● Improved the resolution of multiple textures. 
* Adjusted certain areas in the Childhood scene to prevent them from being walkable. 
* The Resume option on the Main Menu now only appears when a saved game is present. 
* The Resume option now appears on the Pause Menu even if there is no save file. 
* Fixed the Pause Menu not to appear when pausing while playing a New Game after uninstalling and reinstalling the game. 
* Game objectives are now completely marked when completed. 
* Added a delay in the Childhood scene to allow players to see the cat running away. 
* Corrected the position of the entrance dialog to prevent reading from the inside. 
* Adjusted position of Johanna’s drawing on the box for easier pickup. 
* Resolved bugs that made navigating stairs in the Childhood scene difficult or impossible. 
* Fixed subtitles not working correctly on Warehouse PC videos. 
* Fixed Russell entering the Home and GOAT scenes looking in the wrong direction. 
* Fixed issues with backwards teleporting leaving you out of bounds. 

* Known issues (will be fixed soon!): It is possible to fall while in the GOAT elevators if moving too much. If this happens, you may need to reload the scene.

The Signifier (VR) - Patch 01

*The standing and sitting modes were corrected, so that the height of the player feels better. 
*The length and shape of the raycasting was adjusted for enhanced teleportation accuracy. Now the position where the player will land is displayed.
*The dominant hand can now be changed in the Main Menu. 
*The vignette functionality was improved: it is now deactivated when rotating, and customizable in the VR settings. 
*VR settings adjusting was added at the start of a New Game. 
*The control panel UI was enhanced for a smoother experience and to avoid accidental button pressing. 
*The lighting on the Main Menu was fine-tuned to prevent discomfort.

Bug fixing: 
-Many issues that caused the player to fall on multiple areas were fixed. 
-The bug that caused the player to be trapped in memories was fixed. 
-Certain areas that were unintentionally walkable now are not.  
-The bugs that prevented the player from walking in the warehouse and other areas of the game were fixed. 
-The issue allowing the player to interact with objects and casting the teleport ray through walls was fixed. 
-The colliders that made the interaction with the dialog system difficult when talking with Stan were adjusted.
